full_text: I'm Meg Morrill and I basically just help with all things travel and expense. Pluralsight is headquartered in beautiful Draper, Utah. It is a tech workforce development company. Part of what we were looking for is to kind of consolidate, have a one-stop-shop solution that was available for everybody. We wanted all of our team members to have equal access. Having that disjointed solution and workarounds... it was very much a lot of workarounds. Especially around reporting, it was very difficult to get the data from the different sources to patch it together somehow and to present it in a way that made sense. Because our team members and our travelers are our number one priority, we were looking for a tool that also felt the same way. And it was clear that with Navan, that was the case. Like, the tool was built around the user; it wasn't about the tool itself. It felt like with Navan you were already putting the traveler first, and it was only going to get better and bigger as we went along.
